en.label: Absalom Station Calendar (Starfinder)
en.description: The galactic standard calendar used throughout the Pact Worlds, based on the ancient Golarion calendar but adapted for space travel and interplanetary coordination.

months.name: Abadius
months.description: Named after Abadar, the master of the first vault. A time for trade negotiations across the Pact Worlds.

months.name: Calistril
months.description: Named after Calistria, goddess of lust and revenge. Gains an extra day in leap years.

months.name: Pharast
months.description: Named after Pharasma, Lady of Graves. A time when the boundary between life and undeath grows thin.

months.name: Gozran
months.description: Named after Gozreh, the wind and the waves. Celebrated across water worlds and space stations.

months.name: Desnus
months.description: Named after Desna, the song of the spheres. A time for interstellar travel and exploration.

months.name: Sarenith
months.description: Named after Sarenrae, the dawnflower. Solar energy systems receive maintenance during this month.

months.name: Erastus
months.description: Named after Erastil, old deadeye. A time for colonial settlements and agricultural worlds.

months.name: Arodus
months.description: Named after the lost god Aroden. The peak of technological advancement and innovation.

months.name: Rova
months.description: Named after Rovagug, the rough beast. A time when ancient evils stir across the galaxy.

months.name: Lamashan
months.description: Named after Lamashtu, the mother of monsters. Biosecurity protocols are heightened.

months.name: Neth
months.description: Named after Nethys, the all-seeing eye. A time of magical research and technomagical discovery.

months.name: Kuthona
months.description: Named after Zon-Kuthon, the midnight lord. The darkest month in the void between stars.

weekdays.name: Moonday
weekdays.description: Named after celestial bodies, adapted for various planetary cycles

weekdays.name: Toilday
weekdays.description: A day for labor and maintenance across the Pact Worlds

weekdays.name: Wealday
weekdays.description: A day for prosperity and interplanetary commerce

weekdays.name: Oathday
weekdays.description: A day for keeping treaties and diplomatic agreements

weekdays.name: Fireday
weekdays.description: A day of energy and solar system-wide activities

weekdays.name: Starday
weekdays.description: A day for navigation, exploration, and stellar observation

weekdays.name: Sunday
weekdays.description: A day of rest observed across diverse worlds and species
